Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.context: NodeContext: Exclamation during combat, ordering lackeys

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_001.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_001.text: Gonna poke some extra holes in you!

BridgeSign.speaker: Player
BridgeSign.context: NodeContext: Reading a signpost. Elturel pronounced 'ELL-tur-ELL'. Baldur pronounced 'Ball-dur'

EmptyMindflayerPod.speaker: Narrator
EmptyMindflayerPod.text: *An empty mind flayer vessel. If its occupant survived, they're nowhere to be seen.*

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_002.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_002.text: The Absolute's got my back - I ain't afraid of nothin'!

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_003.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_003.text: The worms'll feast on your sorry carcass when I'm done with you!

AD_Vanish.speaker: Raphael
AD_Vanish.text: Bah! To hell with the devil, is it? Very well, I shall oblige.

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.text: I don't like this at all.
Dinner.context: NodeContext: This place is in the Hells, though Karlach doesn't realize that yet. She's put off but trying to stay cool.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: Tut tut. No need for that crude cutlery of yours. As you can see, I'm amply provisioned.
Dinner.context: CinematicNodeContext: He gestures across the table: plenty of silverware present.NodeContext: He gestures across the table: plenty of silverware present.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: This is the House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.

AD_DoorMarks.speaker: Narrator
AD_DoorMarks.text: *Names and heights have been carved into the wood over the years. The last two read 'Maggie Terrens' and 'Marcus Terrens'. Twins, perhaps.*

Village_Trespassing.text: You sent from Moonrise, drow? 'Cos otherwise, I'll have to cut ya.

VB_OwlBearPrints.speaker: Player
VB_OwlBearPrints.text: Looks like a beast came through here - a big one too.
VB_OwlBearPrints.context: NodeContext: Cautious. Spoken in reference to a large set of animal tracks they've spotted.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: A wine bottle? A scholar with good taste, perhaps.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Or maybe a bit of a drinking problem.

AD_MissingPoster.speaker: Narrator
AD_MissingPoster.text: *Missing children: Maggie Terrens, Marcus Terrens, Mathen Deetch, Rochelle Kirk*

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: I've got the plans and the sussur bark. Now I need somewhere to craft it all.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: The forge at the blacksmith's house should do.

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *A candy-sweet scent wafts forth: the sussur bark infuses the weapon from within the flames.*

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *The flames sputter away. The sword is complete.*

VB_TakePlans.speaker: Player
VB_TakePlans.text: Weapon blueprints. They call for sussur bark...

VB_TakeJournal.speaker: Player
VB_TakeJournal.text: Interesting. I wonder if those blueprints survived.

PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.speaker: Player
PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.text: If only I knew where to find some.

VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.speaker: Player
VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.text: What in the hells was that?

VB_FindWeakWall.speaker: Player
VB_FindWeakWall.text: A wonder this shoddy wall hasn't already collapsed.

PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.speaker: Player
PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.text: The bark is in place. Now, for a greatsword, dagger, or sickle.

AD_Combat_Goblins_Caster_01.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_Combat_Goblins_Caster_01.text: Gonna add your ears to my collection once you're dead!

PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.speaker: Goblin Brawler
PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.text: Oi! You fightin' them ogres, then you fightin' with me!

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: These things abandon their hosts as soon as they need to. Vile parasites...

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: The longer we wait, the likelier that we share in this fate, or worse. Let's get rid of these things.

AD.speaker: Player
AD.text: This trunk's rotten; shouldn't put too much weight on it.
AD.context: NodeContext: Cautious; just realising how precarious their position is (crossing a dangerously weak tree trunk bridge).

AD_Crack.speaker: c1a1d9d2-d3b5-49fc-ad48-9312552c7caa
AD_Crack.context: InternalNodeContext: SFX only - wood creaking and snapping under strain.NodeContext: SFX only - do not record

PAD_AfterFight.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterFight.text: Never thought I'd ever walk in on a bugbear and an ogre.

PAD_AfterFight.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterFight.text: Everytime I close my eyes, I can see... it.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Huh. Haven't seen that game in years.
PAD.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Little sing-song to the tune of 'one, two, buckle my shoe'

Spotted.speaker: Chock
Spotted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ogres eating a corpse and remark on what it tastes like, custom scene viewer

Spotted.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
Spotted.text: Gentlemen - contain yourselves. This quarrel sours our feast. Besides - taste like pork!

Spotted.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
Spotted.text: Brothers, look here. I have eyed yet another prize. Fortune favours our bellies!

Spotted.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
Spotted.text: Stranger: be you friend or food? The mark is Her measure: show us the brand of the Absolute.

Spotted.speaker: Player
Spotted.text: You're quite eloquent for an ogre.

Spotted.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
Spotted.text: Am I not astonishing? A robust diet makes for a shrewd mind, you see. I am a gourmand...

Spotted.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
Spotted.text: ... and you, a delicacy - unless you bear the mark, of course.

AfterSummon.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AfterSummon.text: No more than a few pecks? I'm afraid this spread is most inadequate.

AfterSummon.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AfterSummon.text: Our bargain is at an end - unless, perhaps, you've a spicier deal?
AfterSummon.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rubbing for finger and thumb together illuding to the oger wanting gold.NodeContext: *Dupe* [Lump The Enlightened]  Rubbing for finger and thumb together illuding to the oger wanting gold. <JACK OF>

AfterSummon.speaker: Player
AfterSummon.text: Our deal is done. I wish you well.

AfterSummon.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AfterSummon.text: Without so much as a lick of that mouth-watering meat of yours?

AfterSummon.speaker: Player
AfterSummon.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player extends arm to ogre.

AfterSummon.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AfterSummon.context: CinematicNodeContext: Consider a less reveling angle so that individual player armor is not clipping thu Lumpâ€™s face.NodeContext: Lump is savoring your arm. treating it as a special treat, with much pomp and circumstance.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Weapon blueprints. A master blacksmith's work.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The inking is rough - a work in progress, surely.

LastCub.speaker: Narrator
LastCub.text: *The cub looks from you to his dead mother.*
LastCub.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cub looks from dead mother to the player, wailing.NodeContext: Narrator node!

VB_CubResolution_2P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_2P.text: At least the cub has a fighting chance now.
VB_CubResolution_2P.context: NodeContext: Reasoning; justifying decision to let an orphaned animal cub live.

VB_CubResolution_2P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_2P.text: That, or we've just prolonged its misery.
VB_CubResolution_2P.context: NodeContext: Unconvinced. Wondering if it would've been better to kill the animal.

VB_CubResolution_1P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_1P.text: Nature can provide for the cub. Perhaps it'll live.
VB_CubResolution_1P.context: NodeContext: Reasoning decision to let an orphaned owlbear cub fend for itself.

CMB_Enrage.speaker: Owlbear
CMB_Enrage.context: CinematicNodeContext: Charges to attack.NodeContext: Horrified and enraged

PAD_KilledByGoblins.speaker: Player
PAD_KilledByGoblins.text: Looks like the goblins found her.

AD_HatchedEgg.speaker: Player
AD_HatchedEgg.text: Owlbear eggshells... an unhatched one would fetch quite a price...
AD_HatchedEgg.context: NodeContext: Speaking from knowledge or experience. The player recognises the egg they've spotted and the price that an intact one could fetch.

VB_LastCub.speaker: Player
VB_LastCub.text: A lone cub isn't much of a threat...

VB_LastCub.speaker: Player
VB_LastCub.text: Not without its mother by its side. What now?

VB_EnterCave.speaker: Player
VB_EnterCave.text: That stench... dead owlbear prey, no doubt.
VB_EnterCave.context: NodeContext: Upon entering the den of a carnivorous beast. Rotting, half-eaten prey are strewn about. The player previously identified the beast as an owlbear.

ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.speaker: Narrator
ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.text: *This fight could have been avoided, but now you've made it inevitable.*
ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.context: NodeContext: Hostile. A pre-combat utterance potentially spoken by any goblin or worg at the windmill

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Goblin Warrior
CheckpointGuards.text: 'Allo and welcome to Bogrot! Now, kindly - giz all your stuff.
CheckpointGuards.context: NodeContext: A goblin's closest approximation of courtesty, faintly mocking. He's loudly welcoming you to the town he has dubbed 'Bogrot'

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuards.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

CheckpointGuardsWarning.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
CheckpointGuardsWarning.context: NodeContext: We caught him idling at the entrance of a checkpoint. Not trying very hard with the lie.

Warning.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
Warning.text: More of our crowd inside, but we'll send word you're all right.
Warning.context: NodeContext: We've been let past a checkpoint, she's reassuring us we won't be attacked.

AD_StartedCombat.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_StartedCombat.text: You must got a death wish, sneakin' around in my town.

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *The well stands, as it has for ages.*

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Apart from an overgrowth of moss, the well looks unremarkable.*

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Dry stones line the wall, but the darkness below is impenetrable.*

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.text: I feel a breeze - I wonder what's down there.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.context: NodeContext: This person doesn't trust it.

AD_EttercapDisturbanceWarning.context: NodeContext: A bit like a spider chirp, but a bit louder, if possible.

SpeedUp.speaker: Narrator
SpeedUp.context: NodeContext: Intentionally blank for cinematic purposes
CinematicNodeContext: Unfortunate Gnome gets flung off.

AD_Plead.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_Plead.context: NodeContext: mocking barcus as he (barcus) flies on the windmill pane.

AD_Plead.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_Plead.context: NodeContext: Calling down to a goblin who has him captive on the windmill. Said while spinning on windmill.

AD_WaitingForRelease.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_WaitingForRelease.context: NodeContext: Barcus shouts for help - the windmill he's tied to is rotating, and he needs someone to halt it before he can be cut loose. Urgent, at the end of his tether.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.text: Come on! What are you waiting for?!
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: The gnome grows exasperated and panicky over the player's delay in cutting him free.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome is tied to the (stationary) sail of a wind, begging to be cut free by the player. He's close to the ground and within normal speaking range.NodeContext: Urgent, panicked. The gnome begs to be untied from the sail of a windmill. The sail is at the lowermost part of its rotation in relation to the ground, and the gnome is within normal speaking range.

TiedUp.speaker: Player
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Incredulous. His good samaritan seems to be haggling for a reward before even freeing him.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Impatient. He's used to being extorted.

PAD_SeluniteNecklace.speaker: Player
PAD_SeluniteNecklace.context: NodeContext: Upon seeing a Selunite necklace

AD_FoundJournal.speaker: Player
AD_FoundJournal.text: Someone's diary. Might explain what happened here.

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The book radiates power, but the words you read in the Codex echo in your mind, guiding your eyes safely across the page.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The once-indecipherable glyphs now feel dangerously familiar, promising unholy power to those who can take it.*

Tome.speaker: Player
Tome.text: Read on and wrest the book's power from it.

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *As you parse the strange glyphs, you can feel the book resisting. Ghostly voices whisper at you from the dark - probing and fighting your mind.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *But your will is iron and you brush past these shades of the past, devouring every secret the book has to offer.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *You see now, life and death are malleable as clay, to be bent and reshaped by your will. By your power.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *But as you close the book, a nagging doubt whispers in your mind. What consequences will there be for calling the dead from their rest?*

PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.text: Sorry, but that book is spoken for - by me.

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *The tiefling's corpse stirs with the spell.*

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *You realise the tiefling's body has been torn open by huge hands.*

003_Dead.speaker: Edowin
003_Dead.text: Edowin... a True Soul... a Chosen...

AD_Mocking.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Mocking.context: NodeContext: Jeering/mocking, and a bit sing-song

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: Wha', fun's over? All right then...

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: C'mon, blood-breath. Let's find you something to eat.
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a worg companion, urging it to come along.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Worg
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Worgs are vicious beasts but have a little more sentience than most animals, and are capable of rudimentary speech.
